content.description: Slab climbing on beautiful clean granite.  Start to the left of the the crack that forms the right edge of the formation .  The first bolt is a bit up over easy ground.  Keep trending left, following the bolts to the anchors.  Crux after 2nd bolt.
content.protection: 7 bolts to anchors (shared with other routes)
content.location: This route is to the right of Bosch Gnarley and shares the same anchors.  It starts to the left of the left arching crack that goes to near the top of the formation. There are two bolted routes in between Bosch Gnarley and Rat in the Kitchen.

content.description: Start up a slabby seam to a black bulge. Then back to steep, sustained, slabby seam with occasional finger locks. First slab crux is bolt protected (the only bolt) and next slab crux is protected by thin gear and is a bold move.  P1 belay at a nice sandy ledge ~180' 10c.  P2 starts up a steep thin crack. Continues up thin crack until it goes away, then step right (10a crux) for a wild lie back and thin face climbing until you can step right again into a wide crack. Follow to top.
content.protection: 1 bolt, gear R.P.'s to a 3" piece.  Mostly thin.  Gear anchors
content.location: Trenchtown Rock, right side.  Big slab against base of cliff, the crack on right that starts from it.  NOT the polish thin crack up the left.   Walk off left 2nd and 3rd class.   (there are supposed to be rap anchors on the polish thin crack, but we didn't see any and opted to walk off)

content.description: Beautiful slab climbing on gorgeous rock. Crux is after 4th bolt. At the top go right to the common anchors of (L to right) Bosch Gnarley, Prodigal Sun, Burnin' and Lootin' and Rat in the Kitchen.
content.protection: 7 bolts, 1 piece of gear (take a few small pieces between 1/2"-1") after bolt 3 in the horizontal crack.
content.location: This route is located on the left side of Trenchtown Rock.  In the photo on the area page, this is the leftmost section you can see in that photo.  This is not the leftmost route, but is the most left route with a bolt down low. Rappel with two ropes from anchors.

content.description: Not sure if its been redpointed. Beautiful thin crack up a gold polish face.
content.location: Left center of right side trenchtown rock
